Management

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Management.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Ohlbach on 03.09.2018.
    This class controls the processing of the problems.
    It
    - analyses the input parameters
    - reads or generates the SAT-problems
    - distributes them ovrer several threads
    - activates the solvers
    - collects the results and statistics

      • Controller

        public Controller(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> globalInputParameters,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> problemInputParameters,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> solverInputParameters)
        generates a new controller
        Parameters:
        globalInputParameters - for global control
        problemInputParameters - the problem specifications
        solverInputParameters - the taskSupplier specifications

    • Method Detail

      • analyseParameters

        public boolean analyseParameters()
        analyses the input specifications and turns them into internal data structures.
        Returns:
        true if the processing can continue, false if it should stop.

      • analyseProblemParameters

        private void analyseProblemParameters()
        analyses the applicationParameters and turns them into sequences of objectParameters

      • analyseSolverParameters

        private void analyseSolverParameters()
        analyses the solverParameters and turns them into sequences of objectParameters

      • reportErrors

        private boolean reportErrors()
        prints errors and warnings
        Returns:
        true if the processing can continue, false if it should stop

      • reportResults

        private void reportResults()
        prints all results to the resultfile.

      • solve

        public boolean solve()
        initiates the solution of the problems. A ProblemSupervisor is generated for each problem. It takes care of invoking the solvers
        Returns:
        true if the problem was solved

      • distributeProblems

        private void distributeProblems()
        distributes the problems to different threads.

      • solveProblems

        private void solveProblems(int n,
                           int size)
        solves a group of problems
        Parameters:
        n - the prepareClauses index of the problems to be solved
        size - the number of problems to be solved sequentially

      • printStatistics

        public void printStatistics()
        collects and prints all statistics

      • printIndividualTextStatistics

        private void printIndividualTextStatistics(java.io.PrintStream out,
                                           java.util.ArrayList<Statistic[]> statistics)
        prints for each problem separately all statistics
        Parameters:
        out - where to print.
        statistics - with entries: statistics of [problem,preprocessor,central processor, solvers ...]

      • printCombinedTextStatistics
